intro: Linaria heterophylla f. glaberrima, commonly known as the glabrous toadflax, is a compact, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a variant of the species Linaria heterophylla, characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves and stems. The plant produces vibrant yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive spurred structure, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms and easy maintenance.
